result.execSummary:
The defendant Alline Tiffany-Toy Waterman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA  and Victim surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
Cash bail previously posted to apply.
- Restitution set at zero.

- No contact with firearms.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

- Mental health evaluation.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined by the agent.
- Follow all court orders.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alline Tiffany-Toy Waterman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: No reply from defendant or surety. DZ
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($500.00) gj

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction with credit for 88 days served. 

 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 24 months with the following conditions:

- No contact with Jessica M.
- Mental health evaluation.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined by the agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Follow all court orders. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA  and Victim surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. Cash bail previously posted to apply.
- Restitution set at zero. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).
Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Alline Tiffany-Toy Waterman in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Alline Tiffany-Toy Waterman in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI

Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1 :

The defendant was advised of her Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Sentencing proceeded...

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Alline Tiffany-Toy Waterman not in court, in custody, not produced.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case set for plea and sentencing. Defendant was incorrectly produced to Children's Court. Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 5/3/2016 at 8:15 a.m. in Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 08:15 am.
TOT Justicepoint

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Alline Tiffany-Toy Waterman not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel was just appointed. Case is set for plea/sentencing on 4-26-2016.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 3-13-2016
Bench Warrant in file.  
Case is adjourned to 3-23-2016 at 8:15am
for Return on Bench Warrant in Branch 38.
Notice is given to Public Defender's Office and District Attorney.
Justice Point Discharge Report, received and filed.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Gregory A. Renden in court.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense counsel has not had contact with defendant; defendant also violating Justice Point.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court. *** Court makes findings that there is a possible victim(s) identified therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

15RM029350  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/13/2015
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed.
TOT to Justice Point: no drugs or alcohol; random testing; no firearms or other weapons.  Court ordered that the No Contact Order remain in full force and effect.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $500.00 cash.

Defendant Alline Tiffany-Toy Waterman in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State is unable to locate its victim at this time; requested an adjournment. Defense does not object, but would like a bail hearing.  Court granted State's request and ordered case adjourned for scheduling.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alline Tiffany-Toy Waterman in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Alline Tiffany-Toy Waterman in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki for James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Plea date scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Alline Tiffany-Toy Waterman
Current: 4558 N 26TH ST, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 05-10-2015)
Prior: 3020 North Teutonia Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53206

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JESSICA M. AND LAMAN W.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Alline Tiffany-Toy Waterman in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Alline Tiffany-Toy Waterman in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

COURT ORDERED DNA SAMPLE TO BE OBTAINED BY SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
